property.name: text
property.value: This "trilateration" model simulates the computation of the position of a target based on the time of receipt of a transmission received at three detectors. Each detector contains a local clock that is normally synchronized to the others. The detectors are located at (0,0), (a,0), and (0,b). The key blocks and their functions are: 1-"Target Signal Generator". This block generates events that model the time of receipt of the transmitted signal. A fixed number of events are generated along a parabolic path or at a fixed point depending on system parameters. 2-"Target Signal Detectors". These blocks contain local clocks that are used to generate timestamps upon receipt of the transmitted signal. 3-"Trilateration". This block computes the target position (and signal transmission time at the target) based on the timestamps received from each detector and the known locations of the detectors.

property.name: text
property.value:
SYSTEM PARAMETERS: The main system parameters are defined as: 1) sound: When true the velocity is 300m/s for sound when false 3*10^8 m/s for EM waves. 2) MovingTarget: boolean 3) Synchronized: boolean 4) GoodClock: true=> drift of GCD, false => 10*GCD true=> noise of GCOSI, false => 8*GCOSI 5) PerfectClock: true=> all drifts and noise zero Note that unsynchronized clocks will drift apart at the clock drift rate.
Lesser (and "fixed") parameters are: a) goodClockOneSigmaImpairment (GCOSI): the noise of the clocks b) goodClockDrift (GCD): free run clock drift c) pathPoints: number of points on path d) a: detector 2 at (a,0) in meters e) b: detector 3 at (0,b) in meters f) eventStartTime: absolute time when target transmissions begin (to allow clocks to sync)
Hidden parameters are derived from these.

property.name: text
property.value: The detectors have different drift properties based on whether the clocks are poor, good, or perfect: Detector 1: zero drift Detector 2: + the selected drift rate Detector 3: - the selected drift rate

property.name: text
property.value: The models within the red rectangle constitute the system. The other models serve only to compute statistics and display properties and performance.

property.name: text
property.value:
The target signal generator produces a series of events representing the location of the target and the time at which the event is received at the detectors. The target location is either moving along a parabola y=(3.6b/a^2)(x-a/2)^2 determined by the "Path Generator" actor or at a fixed location (a,0.9b) as determined by the "Fixed Location" actor.
For each target location the coordinates X0,Y0 are output to drive the display. In addition the delay of the signal from the target to each of the detectors is computed based on the velocity parameter representing either sound or electromagnetic wave propagation velocity. After the appropriate delay the event is sent to the detector.
The formula for the delay is (delay*velocity)^2 = Di^2 = (X0-Xdetector)^2 +(Y0-Ydetector)^2
The detectors are assumed to be at: (0,0), (0,b), and (a,0) all dimensions in meters.

property.name: text
property.value:
Generates points along the parabola y=(3.6b/a^2)(x-a/2)^2.
The first points is at x=0 and the last at x=a.

property.name: text
property.value: Generates points along the parabola at the last point on the parabola y=(3.6b/a^2)(x-a/2)^2, i.e. at x=a, y=(0.9)b.

property.name: text
property.value: This actor computes values for the position of the target (X,Y) and the time at which the target transmitted the signal based on the timestamps generated by each detector upon receipt of the signal and the known location of the detectors.

svg.text: Create a state machine here (and ports, if needed) and create refinements for the states. Create transitions by holding the (Mac: command key, Windows: control key) and dragging from one state to another. Right click to configure the properties of this model, including setting the final state(s). Then delete this annotation.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model computes the errors between the true and computed values of: target position (X,Y) and the time the target transmits the signal. The signal of course arrives at the detectors at different times depending on the relative position os the target and detectors.
In addition this block displays pertinent system information and statistics to aid the user in interpreting simulation results.

property.name: text
property.value: For a sequence of inputs: a) The number of inputs is monitored to detect when numPoints have been received. When numPoints = N have been received then the mean and standard deviation of the set is computed. b) The mean = (sum (inputs))/N c) The standard deviation is computed using the estimator sigma = sqrt{sum(input - mean)^2/(N-1)} this can be rearranged to sigma = sqrt{[(sum(input)^2 - N*(mean)^2]/(N-1)}

display.name: Mean&StdDev of target transmit time error

property.name: text
property.value: For a sequence of inputs: a) The number of inputs is monitored to detect when numPoints have been received. When numPoints = N have been received then the mean and standard deviation of the set is computed. b) The mean = (sum (inputs))/N c) The standard deviation is computed using the estimator sigma = sqrt{sum(input - mean)^2/(N-1)} this can be rearranged to sigma = sqrt{[(sum(input)^2 - N*(mean)^2]/(N-1)}

entity.name: StringConst

property.name: value
property.value: Computed vs Actual Position Error Statistics (meters)

entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst2

property.name: value
property.value: Computed vs Actual Target Transmit Time Error Statistics (seconds)

entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst6

property.name: value
property.value: Clock2 and Clock3 Skew Statistics wrt Clock1 at Event Times (seconds)

entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value:
Parses the primary input parameters and based on this parsing sets the values of other system parameters. The model also generates textual information for display.
The stopTime parameter is used in the "stop execution" actor to terminat the simulation after the last point has been computed.

property.name: text
property.value:
The two "exception" actors monitor for values of a and b that will cause the maximum sound propagation time between the target and the various receivers to exceed the inter event interval.
The other actor ensures that the number of points is at least 2.

property.name: message
property.value: pathPoints must be greater or equal to 2.

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst2
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst3
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst4
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst5
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst6
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst7
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst8
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst9
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst10
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst11
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst12
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value:
Each detector accepts an event signal "eventTrigger" indicating that a transmission has been received from the target. The local time of receipt of this event is sent to the trilateration block for analysis.
The time or receipt is generated in the "Dectector" block. The "Controller" block enforces clock synchronization, noise and drift properties of the local clock based on the parameters received from the "System Parameters" block.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the clockRate as the sum of the differentialClockDrift (clockRate -1) of selected input plus any impairments added by this clock. The impairments are modeled by the device parameters which allow for changes in the value of added clock drift at times determined by the parameters.
The most recent event actors are needed since the clockRate value must be updated whenever there is a change which can occur due to changes in the parent's clock drift or by impairments introduced by this device.
The definition of the impairment parameters is as follows: =>impairmentPeriod: The value is the period of the impairment which consists of a sawtooth deviation in time. =>oneSigmaTimeImpairment: The one sigma positive or negative time excursion from the mean. =>freeRunDrift: The drift rate of the clock when not synchronized to its parent. Nominal values are <100PPM. =>tightZeroMean: When true the impairments are symmetrical around 0 during each impairment period. When false zero mean is achieved based on the statistics of the impairments.
The ImpairmentStatistics block provides a radom perturbation of the clockRate once each impairment period. The values are based on a normal distribution. The ImpairmentPatternGenerator block provides the multipliers at the appropriate times to form the impairment waveform.
The input driving the synchronization is determined by the mode parameter as follows: => mode = 0: clock is free running. Only the drift and impairments are used. => mode = 1: the clock synchronizes to the time signal on the timeFromMaster port. => mode = 2: the clock synchronizes to the time of the environment- normally oracle time.
The entire controller could be placed in the controlled clock itself EXCEPT that the Sync Rate Clock actor in this model MUST use oracle time rather than local time as would be the case if it were in the controlled clock actor.

property.name: text
property.value: The limiter is set to ensure that the clockRate output is never <= zero, i.e. the clock should not go backward.

property.name: text
property.value:
This composite actor generates perturbation values for the clockRate such that the values are from a normal distribution.
The Uniform block generates random doubles from a uniform distribution which after rounding yield random integers from 0 to 197. These values are used as the index to access the lookup table. The table contains multiples of the impairment distributed such that their density in the table reflects a normal distribution.

entity.name: Uniform
entity.doc: Create a sequence of uniformly distributed random numbers

property.name: text
property.value: This block generates the per period waveform that defines the impairment pattern. For the tightZeroMean value of true this is a sawtooth waveform symmetrical about zero. For a value of false it is a sawtooth beginning and ending on zero.

property.name: text
property.value:
The clockRate parameter port sets the clockRate attribute of the DE director. This in turn is the rate parameter used by the director in computing the advancment of the local clock with respect to its environment. A clockRate of 1.0 indicates that the local and environment clocks run at the same rate, i.e. have the same definition of the second.
The purpose of this clock is to provide a proxy for the actual controlled clock. In particular this proxy is driven by the same rate signal as the controlled clock and therefore provides the same local time as the controlled clock which can be used internally by the controller during tracking of time from the master.

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

svg.text: This modal model and its state refinements sets the connection patterns between the controller input signal timeFromMaster and the internal signals from the oracle and syncRate clocks to the PID that provides the tracking signal.

This modal model detects the presence or absence of a signal on the parentSignal port (ultimately the timeFromMaster port on the top level of the controller). The parentSignalPresent output drives the modal model in the controller that determines the connection patterns to the clockRate generation actors.

property.name: text
property.value:
When an event is received on the eventTrigger port the receipt time is sent to the eventTime port.
The clockRate parameter port sets the clockRate attribute of the DE director. This in turn is the rate parameter used by the director in computing the advancment of the local clock with respect to its environment. A clockRate of 1.0 indicates that the local and environment clocks run at the same rate, i.e. have the same definition of the second.

property.name: text
property.value: Computes and plots the difference between the local time at each of the "Detector" blocks and oracle time (the time of the outer DE director).

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the mean and standard deviation of the differences between the value of Clock2 and Clock3 with respect to Clock1 at the times of the events on Clock2 and Clock3 respectively.
Clocks 1, 2, and 3 are the local clocks in "Detector" blocks 1, 2, and 3 respectively.

svg.text: When an event has been received on each port a trigger is generated and the state machine reset.
When an event has been received on each port a trigger is generated and the state machine reset.

display.name: Mean&StdDev of clock2 wrt clock 1 time errors

property.name: text
property.value: For a sequence of inputs: a) The number of inputs is monitored to detect when numPoints have been received. When numPoints = N have been received then the mean and standard deviation of the set is computed. b) The mean = (sum (inputs))/N c) The standard deviation is computed using the estimator sigma = sqrt{sum(input - mean)^2/(N-1)} this can be rearranged to sigma = sqrt{[(sum(input)^2 - N*(mean)^2]/(N-1)}
